page.title: 02BRIEF HISTORY OF B/WALTHAM
page.content: Bishops Waltham has existed as a settlement since the{Stone Age.}There are buildings dating back to the 1400s,some originally constructed as open halls. It was a thriving market town with public houses and stalls. Most of the shops were built in 1400s. Early{industries}include rope and brick making alongside wool. The town has always depended on its {agriculture,}though the decline left it in a poor state. Bishops Waltham is now growing rapidly in size and in prosperity. The palace, a health refuge for the {Bishops of Winchester}is now in ruins. It was used as an entertainer's grounds from the time of{William the {Conqueror}and hunting went on in the woods around. Waltham means 'a home in the woods'.
